snippet: The three former prosecutors, one of them a senator, said Vincent A. Cianci Jr., the disgraced former mayor of Providence, R.I., had shown no remorse for his crimes.
abstract: Three former federal prosecutors urge Providence, RI, voters to reject comeback campaign of its former disgraced mayor, Vincent A Cianci Jr; warn that Cianci, who was forced to resign twice after felony convictions, has shown no remorse for his crimes, and that his return could hurt city in several ways, including in its applications for federal grants.

byline.original: By JESS BIDGOOD and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood reported from Providence, and Katharine Q. Seelye from Boston.

lead_paragraph: The three former prosecutors, one of them a senator, said Vincent A. Cianci Jr., the disgraced former mayor of Providence, R.I., had shown no remorse for his crimes.

headline.main: Ex-Prosecutors Urge Voters Not to Bring a Felon Back as Providence’s Mayor
headline.print_headline: Ex-Prosecutors Urge Voters Not to Bring a Felon Back as Providence’s Mayor
